title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 399.11 - Effectiveness of this Part
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 399.11 - Effectiveness of this Part

State Regulations

Except for matters involving fraud (acts committed prior
to August 1, 1983) as defined in section
399.1
(a) of this

Part, the provisions of this Part are superseded by the provisions of Part 359
of this Title. Any matters or procedures commenced pursuant to this Part prior
to the effective date of Part 359 [June 30, 1992] will be continued in
accordance with the provisions of Part 359 as if the matter had been commenced
in accordance with such provisions. Part 359 will apply to all further
proceedings in pending matters initiated pursuant to this Part, except to the
extent that a hearing officer determines that application of this section in a
particular pending matter would not be feasible or create an injustice, in
which event the procedures under this Part may be used. Proceedings held
pursuant to the laws and regulations in existence prior to the time that Part
359 of this Title takes effect will not be impaired by this
regulation. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
ยง
399.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
